channel.title: Baosen Zhang
channel.description: Baosen Zhang is an Assistant Professor in the Electrical Engineering Department at the University of Washington.

item.title: Optimal Control Via Neural Networks: A Convex Approach
item.description:
Paper on using convex neural networks for control

  1. Y. Chen, Y. Shi, and B. Zhang, “Optimal Control Via Neural Networks: A Convex Approach,” ArXiv, 1805.11835, 2018.
    • BibTeX
      • @article{Chen18convex,
  author = {Chen, Y. and Shi, Y. and Zhang, B.},

  year = {2018},
  journal = {ArXiv, 1805.11835},
  link = {https://arxiv.org/abs/1805.11835},
  blog = {2018-8-30-convex_nn}
}

item.title: Optimal Battery Control Under Cycle Aging Mechanisms
item.description:
Paper on using batteries in regulation markets under realistic degradation

  1. Y. Shi, B. Xu, Y. Tan, and B. Zhang, “Optimal Battery Control Under Cycle Aging Mechanisms in Pay for Performance Settings,” To Appear in IEEE Transactions on Automatic Control, 2018.

item.title: Real-Time Prediction of the Duration of Distribution System Outages using NLP
item.description:
Using NLP for Distribution System Outages Duration Prediction, code available here.

  1. A. Jaech, B. Zhang, M. Ostendorf, and D. S. Kirschen, “Real-Time Prediction of the Duration of Distribution System Outages,” To Appear in IEEE Transactions on Power Systems, 2018.

item.title: Pan and Yuanyuan Selected to the Rising Stars Workshop
item.description: Congratulations to Pan and Yuanyuan for being selected to participate in the 2018 Rising Stars in EECS workshop at MIT. The UW EE article is at http://www.ee.washington.edu/spotlight/two-electrical-engineers-selected-to-attend-prestigious-conference-for-women/

item.title: Best Papers in Power and Energy General Meeting and ACE E-Energy
item.description:
PES GM, Best Conference Papers on Power System Planning, Operation, and Electricity Markets

    PES GM, Best Conference Papers on Power System Stability, Control, and Protection

      ACM E-Energy, Best Paper Finalist

item.title: Paper on Using Generative Adversarial Networks for Scenario Generation
item.description:
Scenario generation method using Generative Adversarial Networks, code available here.

  1. Y. Chen, Y. Wang, D. Kirschen, and B. Zhang, “Model-Free Renewables Scenario Generation Using Generative Adversarial Networks,” IEEE Transaction on Power Systems, vol. 33, no. 3, pp. 3265–3275, 2018.
